alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 08 at 3:32AM MST until March 10 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. * WHERE...North Laramie Range. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Outdoor enthusiasts including snow mobilers and hikers can expect very low visibility in moderate snow and blowing snow. Individuals could easily become disoriented and lost. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
